author: Andy Chalk
description: The IWGB union says Rockstar has refused to meet with it to negotiate, so it's time to get the courts involved.
title: Rockstar faces legal action from UK union after firing more than 30 employees last week: 'We are confident that what we’ve seen here is plain and simple union busting'

author: Morgan Park
description: It's just a black and orange jacket, but does it mean more?
title: 'If I see this skin, I shoot first': Arc Raiders players insist anyone wearing this 'sweaty' outfit cannot be trusted

author: Tyler Colp
description: The Midnight expansion prologue is less than a month away.
title: Mark your calendars: World of Warcraft will finally have player housing after 21 years when The War Within's final patch arrives next month

author: Shaun Prescott
description: That applies for the Steam Controller and Steam Frame as well.
title: Steam Machine will start shipping to Australia on the same day as the rest of the world, marking a brave new era for Valve

author: Jacob Ridley
description: You're probably thinking about this sort of stuff a lot more than Valve is.
title: Valve on viral marketing and leaks: 'Everybody assumes we have some sort of like grand plan... and it's literally just somebody fat fingering something'

author: Andy Chalk
description: More than 120,000 people voted to ditch RuneScape's widely-disliked MTX system.
title: RuneScape fans have spoken: 'Treasure Hunter' microtransactions will be scrapped in January as 'part of a wider transformation across Jagex'

author: Jacob Ridley
description: Making wireless VR truly possible.
title: Foveated streaming is the genius tech behind Valve's Steam Frame and its seamless wireless gaming performance

author: Andy Chalk
description: "Congrats on today's announce."
title: Phil Spencer reminds everyone that Xbox is 'one of the largest publishers on Steam' as he congratulates Valve on its new hardware with all the enthusiasm of a man paying his taxes

author: Jacob Ridley
description: Now Arm is Valve's best friend.
title: Valve is all over Arm: SteamOS launching for Arm alongside the Steam Frame, new FEX translation layer for x86 and Arm, and Arm games are coming to Steam

author: Maddi Chilton
description: Narrative time loop RPG Rue Valley fails to do anything with its potent metaphor for depression.
title: Rue Valley review

author: Jacob Ridley
description: One Valve employee essentially made it happen.
title: How gyro support was added to the new Steam Controller is a 'typical Valve story' involving a passionate employee moving desks

author: Jacob Ridley
description: "We're really interested to see what other companies do with the form factor."
title: Valve believes its new Steam Machine could open up a whole new world of SteamOS desktops: 'Put it on, say, something that's running an RX 9070 XT, you would be good to go'

author: Dave James
description: Valve has been loosening a desperate Microsoft's grip on PC gaming one gnarled finger at a time.
title: Valve just quietly redefined what PC gaming can be all while an increasingly delusional Microsoft desperately tries to tell everyone their PC is an Xbox now

author: Jacob Ridley
description: It's still a good upgrade from an Index, however.
title: Valve wants you to know that the Steam Frame is not the Index 2: 'we're trying to do something new with this'

author: Wes Fenlon
description: It's been a big announcement day for Valve. Just not that big.
title: Sorry PC gamers, Valve isn't announcing Half-Life 3 today

author: Rick Lane
description: "We're also weighing that against our future ambitions."
title: Responding to problems in a live-service game is like having a 'big clock,' says Battlefield 6 director: 'You measure and value your time to the player' so they know you're paying attention

author: Jacob Ridley
description: Valve's new VR headset is completely wireless and very convincing.
title: I've tried the Steam Frame and I'm now ready to ditch cables from my virtual reality set-up forever

author: Jacob Ridley
description: The new Steam Controller is a smart way to play PC games on the sofa, stealing the Steam Deck's clever controls.
title: Valve announces the Steam Controller and it's genuinely good: 'we knew we needed to make this controller'

author: Jacob Ridley
description: Wireless connectivity, improved optics, new controllers and a chip all of its own, the Steam Frame looks to be worth the wait.
title: Valve announces the Steam Frame: 'a new way to play your entire Steam library'

author: Jacob Ridley
description: Good things come in threes?
title: Valve announces three new products: the Steam Frame, Steam Machine and Steam Controller

author: Jacob Ridley
description: "We finally have all the software and the hardware bits to make the original vision a reality."
title: Valve's new Steam Machine is a SteamOS-powered mini PC over six times faster than a Steam Deck

author: Sean Martin
description: Investigate the Electrical Substation at the Spaceport for Celeste.
title: How to complete Power Out in Arc Raiders

author: James Bentley
description: Sounds good.
title: Amazon's own-brand condenser microphone blew us away this year, and it's now just $20 in the early Black Friday sales

author: Emma Withington
description: No longer a Botchling.
title: CD Projekt Red was considered the 'ugly child' of CD Projekt as a whole before the first Witcher became a hit: 'They will never earn any money here'

author: James Bentley
description: Almost $100 off our favorite gaming chair is pretty solid.
title: Secretlab's Black Friday sale is now live, and it's one of the best ways to get a gaming chair or desk upgrade for cheap this year

author: Andy Edser
description: I'm not the only one that constantly loses USB drives, right?
title: SanDisk has launched the world's teeny-tiniest 1 TB USB-C drive, which looks to be one sneeze away from total oblivion

author: Robin Valentine
description: Raccoin is about huge payouts, emotional catharsis, and coin ecosystems.
title: I thought this roguelike was just about playing a coin pusher machine, but now I'm breeding herds of rabbits and turning wolf poo into tree fertiliser

author: Zak Storey
description: Unlike any rodent we've ever seen before.
title: Orbital Pathfinder review

author: Jeremy Laird
description: May we introduce Inverse Lithography Technology.
title: Today I learned that the curvy lithography masks used by TSMC to make next-gen GPUs are 'alien', 'psychedelic' and look nothing like chip circuits

author: Lauren Morton
description: Here's when you can take charge of your own Roman province to carve your place into the empire.
title: Anno 117: Pax Romana launch times and release date

author: Sean Martin
description: Search for signs of survivors in the Buried City.
title: How to complete A Warm Place to Rest in Arc Raiders

author: Jacob Fox
description: That's one big horse to bet against.
title: SoftBank just sold its entire $5.83 billion stake in Nvidia but I'm sure it'll all feed back into Team Green's pockets before long

author: Elie Gould
description: "Demonschool is 100% human-made."
title: 'We would rather cut off our own arms': Demonschool developers dispute Nexon CEO's claim that 'every game company is now using AI' in response to Arc Raiders backlash

author: Justin Wagner
description: The roadmap accompanies a host of bug fixes and "general improvements" to saving and stability.
title: Bloodlines 2 just got a new roadmap with Christmas-themed goodies, as well things that probably should have been there from the start like an FOV slider and motion blur toggle

author: Rick Lane
description: Agefield High: Rock the School wants to take you back to the most cringeworthy bits of 2002.
title: Someone's finally making a spiritual successor to Bully, but I wish it wasn't inspired by some of the worst comedies ever made

author: Jacob Fox
description: I think they've nailed it, to be honest. I'm sold.
title: I've never been as excited by a social media website as much as I am by this solo dev's 'cyber-vibe text-only' site that is 'how the internet was supposed to be'

author: Mollie Taylor
description: And Bowser Jr. is the Prowler for some reason.
title: The Super Mario Galaxy Movie is 'weeks away from completing animation' as the Italian plumber prepares to shoot into space next April

author: Justin Wagner
description: Where Winds Meet’s impending launch is turning quite a few heads.
title: A multiplayer wuxia RPG releasing this week has a whopping 10 million pre-registrations, and it might just fill that hole in your heart where a new MMO ought to be

author: Jeremy Laird
description: DIY-APE takes his war on cables to a whole new level.
title: This new Mac Pro-inspired motherboard standard banishes all power cables for a single connector rated at over 2,000 W

author: Rick Lane
description: Bizarre scene goes viral on social media.
title: Far-right Polish politician tries to score points by addressing GTA 6's delay in parliament: 'This is a huge scandal'

description: Embark has been busy.
title: Arc Raiders has been testing duo matchmaking, cosmetics are getting their prices slashed, refunds are being doled out and more free raider decks are on their way

description: All the gaming benefits of 3D V-Cache for a reasonable sum.
title: AMD Ryzen 5 7500X3D review

author: Morgan Park
description: The North Line update brings Stella Montis, a "cold, pristine" region of the Rust Belt, and a pair of new ARC foes.
title: Embark is about to drop a new Arc Raiders map, but first we have to unlock it together in a Helldivers 2-style community event

author: Andy Edser
description: Probably won't need to blow on it first, though.
title: You can slot a Switch 2 into this CRT-equipped retro console like a games cartridge, which sounds like the most satisfying use of a Nintendo product ever

description: "It's the only genre where its name is a mechanic."
title: Former Bungie director thinks the term extraction shooter is 'so dumb' that he wanted to work with Marathon's marketing team to 'create a different genre name'

description: Just keep crawling
title: An Arc Raiders player crawled for 15 minutes to an extraction while downed, all thanks to the best game-clutching MK3 augment

description: This is the first official confirmation we've got.
title: AMD confirms next-gen Zen 6 CPUs to launch in 2026 and 'Medusa' APUs to launch in 2027

author: Mollie Taylor
description: The hunt for a reasonable framerate continues.
title: Monster Hunter Wilds' first Elder Dragon is finally landing in December along with some much-needed optimisation focused on reducing the game's ridiculous load on our poor CPUs

author: Jeremy Laird
description: It's PC compatible but doesn't look hugely compelling.
title: Sony's new 'PlayStation' gaming monitor is a relatively unexciting 27-inch 1440p model but it does have a DualSense charging hook

author: Andy Edser
description: Awooga, awooga. Red alert, etc.
title: This is not a typo: You can pick up an RTX 5070 Ti gaming laptop for less than most RTX 5060 machines in the early Black Friday sales and it's an absolute fire-breather

description: A bit nicer than a 200 Yen vendo coffee.
title: Coffee Talk will open the doors to its next instalment on March 5, taking us to the series' most exciting location yet

author: Rory Norris
description: Commit regicide, scrap the Queen for parts, and plunder the Harvester.
title: You can farm Arc Raiders' toughest robot with just a single blue grenade for easy endgame gear and 50,000 XP each time
